result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan J. KENT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan J. KENT

records.addlTxt: Plea date on June 15, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail. The matter is continued for plea date on 06-29-2017 at 1:30 p.m. Bail is set at $1,000.00 cash bail bond with the conditions that he must maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs other than those legally prescribed to him and he must report to MTSO for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information with 48 hours, or if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release. Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail . Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued. Copy filed.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
Warrant Served.

Defendant failed to appear for plea date.   
Bench warrant authorized.    Court orders cash bail forfeited.   
Court sets new bail at $1,000.00 cash.

records.addlTxt: Cover Letter
Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.   Preliminary hearing is set for 09-21-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Possess narcotic drugs-2nd or subsequent offense, on 08-08-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of possess schedule II narcotics.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-31-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs other than those legally prescribed to him.  Bail furnished and the defendant is remanded into custody on a probation hold.
Minutes.
